meanings.definition: To forcibly put an end to something
meanings.sent1: The firefighters were suppressing the flames to save the house.
meanings.sent2: The police were suppressing the riot to restore order.
meanings.sent3: The magician was suppressing the rabbit in his hat, waiting for the right moment to reveal it.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was suppressing the students' excitement until the end of the surprise.
meanings.sent5: The superhero was suppressing the villain's evil plans to protect the city.

meanings.definition: To prevent the development, action, or expression of something
meanings.sent1: Eating healthy can help in suppressing the growth of harmful bacteria in your body.
meanings.sent2: The strict rules were suppressing the creativity of the students.
meanings.sent3: The rainy weather was suppressing the outdoor activities planned for the day.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise was suppressing the ability to concentrate on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The medication was suppressing the symptoms of the illness effectively.

meanings.definition: To keep something secret or hidden
meanings.sent1: She was suppressing her laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent2: The spy was suppressing his true identity to maintain his cover.
meanings.sent3: The treasure map was suppressing the location of the hidden gold.
meanings.sent4: The locked diary was suppressing the secrets of the young girl.
meanings.sent5: The magician was suppressing the trick behind his famous illusion.
